meaningMnemonic: A <radical>drop</radical> of water falls from a <radical>bear</radical> onto the <radical>ground</radical> and needs to be wiped up with a <radical>towel</radical>. Only a <kanji>teacher</kanji> or an <kanji>expert</kanji> could get away with getting close to this wet bear to wipe up after it.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>teacher</kanji> tells you to start with something smaller, after all, you're not an <kanji>expert</kanji> yet. You have to practice on a wet <reading>shee</reading>p (し). "I became a wet, dangerous animal expert by starting with sheep, you will too!" your teacher says.
